official-title.#text:
To create a centralized website on reports issued by the
		  Inspectors General, and for other purposes.

Committee
			 on Oversight and Government Reform

cosponsor.#tail:
) introduced the following
			 bill; which was referred to the

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Director of the Office of
			 Management and Budget

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, shall create a separate
			 website with a distinct URL, that is not under the website of the Office of
			 Management and Budget, about the reports issued by each Office of Inspector
			 General.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Executive Chair of the Council
			 of the Inspectors General on Integrity and Efficiency
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Council of the Inspectors General on Integrity and Efficiency

text.#text:
Not later than 90
			 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the

A
			 general description of the role of the Office of Inspector General.

A description of the types of reports
			 generally issued by the Offices of Inspector General, including the purpose,
			 composition, and process used to create such reports.

A list of each Federal agency or other
			 Federal entity that has an Office of Inspector General and the name and office
			 telephone number for each Inspector General.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, a link to the page of the website through which inspector
			 general reports of such agency or entity can be obtained, including audit
			 reports, management deficiency reports, and the semiannual reports submitted to
			 Congress pursuant to

text.#text: For each agency or entity listed in

Director of the

in a timely manner, ensuring that the information, links to
			 other websites, and contact information are correct.
